responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Lack of Input Validation
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not perform proper input validation, which could allow an attacker
      to inject malicious data into the application. This could potentially lead to various
      security vulnerabilities such as cross-site scripting (XSS), SQL injection, code injection,
      or other types of injection attacks.
    cwe: CWE-20
    function_names:
      - DingdingNotifier
      - DingTalkNotifier
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/ztbsuper/dingding/DingdingNotifier.java
      - src/main/java/com/ztbsuper/dingtalk/DingTalkNotifier.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Use of Externally-Controlled Input in Redirect
    analysis: |
      The DingTalkNotifier class allows external input to be used in constructing a redirect URL
      without proper validation. This could potentially lead to an open redirect vulnerability,
      where an attacker could craft a malicious URL to redirect users to an untrusted site.
    cwe: CWE-601
    function_names:
      - DingTalkNotifier
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/ztbsuper/dingtalk/DingTalkNotifier.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Insecure Transmission of Sensitive Information
    analysis: |
      The codebase appears to transmit sensitive information, such as the access token, over
      an unencrypted channel (HTTP). This could potentially allow an attacker to intercept and
      compromise the sensitive data.
    cwe: CWE-319
    function_names:
      - DingdingServiceImpl
      - DingTalkNotifier
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/ztbsuper/dingding/DingdingServiceImpl.java
      - src/main/java/com/ztbsuper/dingtalk/DingTalkNotifier.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information
    analysis: |
      The codebase may store sensitive information, such as access tokens or credentials, in an
      insecure manner, potentially exposing it to unauthorized access or misuse.
    cwe: CWE-312
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Potential CSRF Vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to implement any Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection
      mechanisms. This could potentially allow an attacker to perform unauthorized actions on
      behalf of an authenticated user.
    cwe: CWE-352
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Lack of Authentication and Authorization
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to implement any authentication or authorization mechanisms.
      This could potentially allow unauthorized access to sensitive functionality or data.
    cwe: CWE-306
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Lack of Input Validation
leads.analysis:
The codebase does not perform proper input validation, which could allow an attacker
to inject malicious data into the application. This could potentially lead to various
security vulnerabilities such as cross-site scripting (XSS), SQL injection, code injection,
or other types of injection attacks.

leads.headline: Use of Externally-Controlled Input in Redirect
leads.analysis:
The DingTalkNotifier class allows external input to be used in constructing a redirect URL
without proper validation. This could potentially lead to an open redirect vulnerability,
where an attacker could craft a malicious URL to redirect users to an untrusted site.

leads.headline: Insecure Transmission of Sensitive Information
leads.analysis:
The codebase appears to transmit sensitive information, such as the access token, over
an unencrypted channel (HTTP). This could potentially allow an attacker to intercept and
compromise the sensitive data.

leads.headline: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information
leads.analysis:
The codebase may store sensitive information, such as access tokens or credentials, in an
insecure manner, potentially exposing it to unauthorized access or misuse.

leads.headline: Potential CSRF Vulnerability
leads.analysis:
The codebase does not appear to implement any Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection
mechanisms. This could potentially allow an attacker to perform unauthorized actions on
behalf of an authenticated user.

leads.headline: Lack of Authentication and Authorization
leads.analysis:
The codebase does not appear to implement any authentication or authorization mechanisms.
This could potentially allow unauthorized access to sensitive functionality or data.
